title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: In particular the author disclaims all allusion to agentleman named Edward Christian, who actuallyexisted during those troublesome times, was brotherof William Christian, the Dempster, and died inprison in the Isle of Man.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Many on the island deny Christian's guilt altogether, like his respectable descendant, the presentDempster; but there are others, and those men ofjudgment and respectability, who are so far of adifferent opinion, that they only allow the executionto have been wrong in so far as the culprit died bya military rather than a civil death.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He was tried, inall due form, by the Dempster, or chief judge, thennamed Norris, the Keys of the island, and otherconstituted authorities, making what is called aTinwald court.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The following Notices were recommended to myattention, in the politest manner possible, by JohnChristian, Esq. of Milntown, in the Isle of Man,and Unrigg, in Cumberland, Dempster at present ofthe Isle of Man.
